website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight, pocket-size keyboard that opens flat and pairs easily with mobile devices for convenient typing on the go.
pros: Smaller than an iPhone and weighing less than half a pound, owners love its portability
The 2 pairs of hinges don't interfere with typing
cons: The compact layout means typists have to adjust to a different key layout
Though not sturdy enough for typing on one's lap, the attachable silicone pads prevent sliding on a tabletop

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my iPhone
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my iPhone. Paired easily via Bluetooth (some devices are a pain to pair, but not this keyboard). It truly is portable and ultra-slim. I've been using it on my iPhone 6s. The keyboard is small which is a good thing for a portable device but it does take a little bit to get used to it, but no big deal. I'm happy with this purchase. Shipping was fast and packaged well.
customer_reviews.author: Alan P.

customer_reviews.title: Very good customer service
customer_reviews.text: The ordered this keyboard a while back and the one I received had a huge lagging between typing and for the letters to appear on the screen. So I returned it and got it refunded. Very shortly afterward, their customer service contacted me and offered to send me a new one to try out. I got the new keyboard in the next few days and it works perfectly. Keys are smooth and very responsive. I am very pleased with their customer service and the way they follow things through.
customer_reviews.author: L.S

customer_reviews.title: This is the coolest keyboard ever ever ever! As ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the coolest keyboard ever ever ever! As a student, it helped to connect this keyboard to my iPad to take notes on so I didn't have to carry my heavy laptop when I walked from my garage to my campus. The only negative is that it is a little noisy when you type in a quiet classroom, but that's okay. I don't have hand cramps any more from handwriting my notes. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully constructed, but doesn't work anymore!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard was great while it worked! Unfortunately, it worked only for 12 days from 12/25/17 until 1/6/18! It won't remain connected to any device anymore. Within a few seconds of being connected, it switches itself into the Bluetooth discovery mode and disconnects from the device. This happens with any and all of the devices that it was paired with and was originally successfully working with: an iPad, an iPhone, an Android tablet, and a Windows phone. This is very unfortunate, because the keyboard is beautifully executed and has a fantastic fit and finish.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine Genie

customer_reviews.title: Extremly useful and love the functional and small form factor
customer_reviews.text: This thing is insane! 1) no I don't get a penny to write a review 2) no I'm not biased and very picky 3) my feedback is based on lots of trial and error After the first unit just flat out didn't work, would not charge. I really wanted the functionality for airline flights and travel. I bought another one and got my return started. Second unit 100% flawless charge and flawless pairing with iPhone. This was worth the cost
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Design Flaw Ruins Touch-Typing
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard's design places the up arrow in the position that the right shift key traditionally occupies. If you are a QWERTY touch-typer, you will inevitably experience unwanted cursor repositioning, resulting in misspellings, confusion, and fury. Do not buy this keyboard if you are a touch-typer.
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay connected
customer_reviews.text: Just received this unit today, feels well built however it keeps disconnecting from my IP7, not just not catching what I am typing, I have to go back into settings and reconnect to it.
customer_reviews.author: Denton Trotter

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I've made lately....
customer_reviews.text: I am an author that also works a full time day job. Until finding this keyboard, I was writing on my lunch and break periods using my thumbs and the scrivener app on my phone. It was slow going, but I figured hey I was getting words in. Fast forward to finding the iClever keyboard! It's compact, fitting perfectly in my purse. It immediately connects to my phone when I open it. The smaller keys and layout took a little getting used to, but once I'd used it a few times, I was good to roll. Now I can get a couple thousand words in small times throughout the day. Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... on it paired up with my phone and worked beautifully, but now won't turn on a second time
customer_reviews.text: When I first turned it on it paired up with my phone and worked beautifully, but now won't turn on a second time. If I plug it in the "charging" light never goes out, and even after hours of charging nothing works, doesn't work, doesn't do bluetooth pairing, doesn't light up when it's opened. Too bad, because it was a great product for the first half hour or so. Based on reviews I suspect these may be very hit or miss in terms of quality and whether you get a working model, which is pretty typical for certain types of electronics on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Sexy, Smart and Sleek
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several bluetooth portable keyboards but was dissatisfied with them for various reasons. The minute I put my handds on the iClever Portable Foldable Bluetooth Keyboard, I knew I had a winner. The design is very sleek and techy. It literally only took me 10 seconds to connext it to my ipad and iphone. The keys have a great feel and are spaced so well that even my "fat finger mistakes" are eliminated. It's compact foldability is terrific. With the keyboard open i can easily balance it on my lap while typing. Overall a great design and performance. And the carry bag is a plus! Oh, and did I mention the great price?
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this keyboard. It synced up with it's vendor and model number which was nice. Typing was nicer that a couple others I've tried. My one grip is the placement of the backspace button. Where it is at, it does not feel natural for typing because of the size of the key. While it is in the normal position for the button, it is much smaller than the |\ which makes it a bit awkward. Has the |\ been smaller (like other keys) and the backspace elongated it may have been better. I went with the Pluggable brand only because the backspace felt more natural.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: A well designed keyboard that works well.
customer_reviews.text: The Keyboard reminds me of the one I had with my HP Jornada. It flolds up and fits into my shirt pocket (admittadly, it is a larger than normal pocket), it works well, and the battery life is good. I have worked on a number of different keyboards and some people might find it takes a bit of an adjustmet as it is just a bit smaller than a standard PC keyboard. I have no prob lem touchtyping and the unit connects automaticallly with the uhit. I have not tried to use the feature that allows it to switch between different computers, tablets, etc. but the instructions look easy enough.
customer_reviews.author: dbibb

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with iPad Pro 10.5 iOS 11
customer_reviews.text: Got this and was super excited about it. Bought it to work with my iPad Pro 10.5 iOS 11. It connected and worked fine the first time around. It still connects to my iPad Pro 10.5 and the HOME button works - but none of the other keys work. I'm not able to type anything using this keyboard and my iPad Pro 10.5. I've written to support@iClever.com about it. Let's see what they say.
customer_reviews.author: Benzi

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect bluetooth keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect keyboard for phones and tablets. I bought this because I typically receive a lot of text messages throughout the day that I have to respond to promptly, and this has totally greased those wheels. Setup was a snap. It's low-profile, charges quickly, has a plethora of function-specific commands, and in general is everything I ever hoped a portable bluetooth keyboard could be. The fact that it folds up like a Transformer is simply a bonus. I call it Optimus Qwerty.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Berry

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly compact and convenient
customer_reviews.text: My favorite thing is how it folds together into a nice compact, sturdy little package and it automatically connects so you're not wasting time and can get to typing right away. I falsely thought it came with a stand to go under the keyboard part, but I don't mind that it doesn't. It's compact and small but very ergonomic and typing on this reduced keyboard is not awkward, it's easy to get used to. Most keyboard shortcuts and functions can be used. I would love it even more if it had a trackpad or a stand for a phone...and if it still compacted into a super neat lil square .
customer_reviews.author: Miryam

customer_reviews.title: Right out of the box, I'm impressed
customer_reviews.text: My new travel companion! This is a great little keyboard. I was immediately impressed, it seems like good quality, all the keys work. I like how the keys feel when typing. Extremely easy to pair with my Droid phone and tablet. I will pair with DH Droid phone later. This is perfect for travel. I'm hoping it will be trouble free going forward. I'll let you know it that changes, but for now. I really like it and it suits my needs. The only thing I would do differently, I wished I bought the one with the touchpad.
customer_reviews.author: TTGOTP

customer_reviews.title: A lemon
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing, this attractive keyboard will not connect with either my iPhone or my iPad Mini. The several times it did connect, it was useful but it has failed to connect ever since. It is months now beyond Amazon's return period. Buyer beware: be sure to test and use it for the first weeks after purchase so as not to be stuck with a useless lemon.
customer_reviews.author: BetsyR

customer_reviews.title: Clever design. Very compact. Self-folding.
customer_reviews.text: I got this keyboard to use with my phone on a 3-month bike tour where I didn't want to carry a laptop. It interfaced with my Android phone just fine, and battery life was decent for my light blogging. Its compactness is impressive. The one big down side for my application is that the "wings" don't lock into place, so I needed a flat surface for typing. I didn't have that luxury most days. Typing in my tent was difficult. Using this as a "lap keyboard" was not possible. Still, I'm glad I didn't have to add a full laptop and charger to my limited luggage space.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Sticky keys and breaks down
customer_reviews.text: The folding concept is amazing for traveling. I linked this with an iPhone and with a Kindle Fire. Unfortunately, the reaction time is slower than my typing time, which isn't fast. Some of the keys eventually stopped working. So I returned it and got a new one because I loved the folding concept. This time, the right half of the keyboard stopped working after maybe 20 uses. So I returned it again and bought the Samsers version. This Samsers keyboard allows for faster typing. And all of the keys actually work.
customer_reviews.author: SunscreenAl

customer_reviews.title: GREAT !
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item for my smart phone because I'm getting up in age and it's not easy to hit those small buttons. :) This keyboard works very well. It quickly recognized the smartphone and I was typing on it after about one minute. Thought I might need a mouse, like my desktop computer, but a lot of the keys are multifunctional and the keyboard handles most of your commands. It's very compact and comes with a nice looking pouch. Good quality that didn't break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: read before action
customer_reviews.text: I just found the arrangements of the keys are kind of weird and the space between keys are slightly different from the normal keyboard, its this slightly different will make big difference in typing, it will influence your typing speed tremendously, because you will find yourself typing the wrong position from time to time. it will take time to get the nerve use to it. I will recommend buy the same idea keyboard, but with the normal key spacing and sizes, it will be bigger, but you will feel much easier in typing and keep your efficiency unimpaired.
customer_reviews.author: VIP customer

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to Love it
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this keyboard. Single key strokes typed two or more characters. When I received the keyboard I had to snap one of the hinges back into the correct socket before it would open. While typing I noticed the sides hyperextend somewhat. Over time the stress may bend or break the joints. I think everything else about this device is great. I would not mind paying a little extra if those fixes are implemented. I had to return the product because it took more time to type on it than on my digital keyboard, which defeated its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Alecs

customer_reviews.title: I’m in love with this keyboard!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! I just put near my phone, open my note or word application and type away. No more need for a larger laptop, or even chromebook to take notes during meetings. I just put my phone on a stand, open the keyboard and start typing. Great for taking notes or sending emails on the go. Folds down compact enough to drop in my briefcase or purse. Battery life is unbelievably long! And the price is fantastic. Fantastic for my carpal tunnel. No more pecking on a tiny phone keyboard. I’m in love!!!
customer_reviews.author: MamaNitaj

customer_reviews.title: Happy typing!
customer_reviews.text: I don't really write that many reviews, but I think this little keyboard is actually worth the time - it's great! Just about the perfect size. It's very small, but large enough to touch type. It also has a great folding design - an older keyboard I owned folded down the middle and closed with a latch, depressing some keys when closed. After a while sitting in a drawer, the keys stuck down - no good. This bi-fold design is much better; it doesn't depress any keys and holds closed with a magnet. My only criticism is that it can't really be used on a lap - unless your legs are closed tight, it will fold up the keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: Christian Skorik

customer_reviews.title: Compact and well made
customer_reviews.text: Item was ordered as a Christmas gift for my wife. She had thought it would be much easier to text and email on her phone. She get many electronic communications during her work day and she doesn’t like thumbing a tiny key board. She’s a very fast typist and much prefers a full-size keyboard. She’s very pleased with this compact folding keyboard. It’s very portable and seems well made. It has already become a part of her daily work haul bag. She’ll be making a protective case for it soon.
customer_reviews.author: NWtarheel

customer_reviews.title: Key inputs producing different ouptut
customer_reviews.text: Something weird is happening with my keyboard. Its producing different outputs then what Im typing. I've tried ensuring keyboard is in USEnglish, etc and set to Android, but for example, when I try to do the @ Symbol, by holding Shift then hitting 2 to get the @ symbol, it gives me quotation marks "", when I hit Shift "" it gives me at Symbol. Please help!
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Non-Functional Out Of Box
customer_reviews.text: I used this exact same product, daily for over a year. It was one of my favorite pieces of technology. Seriously—just couldn’t say enough good about it. Eventually it stopped working due to over-use. That was not the problem. I ordered a new one to replace the old one and it worked out of the box, but stopped working completely (no power and cannot charge) after the first use. Extremely disappointed. I do notice that the manufacture company name has changed in this time, but 100% of the product itself is the same as the old one (except the part where it doesn’t work anymore). Highly discourage buying. Amazing product when it works, but no use if it doesn’t...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SAVED US A TON OF MONEY
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a 2200.00 surface all the bells and whistles. after replacing it 5 times with the warranty. 20 days after the 3 years warranty the keyboard connection dies. they tell us we have to purchase another newer machine. i laughed and said never again. came home found this keyboard and its been amazing almost better then the Microsoft keyboard. and it works with our phones to. cant beat this as an option especially when it fold up all small.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this one.  Buy the newer model.
customer_reviews.text: The key layout makes this keyboard difficult (at best) to use. The right shift key should be next to the "?" key. It isn't. When every I need to capitalize a letter I have to remove my right hand and make sure I strike the correct shift key. If I don't do this I just end up striking the "arrow up" key and then my whole paragraph is messed up. They corrected the key layout on the newer model.
customer_reviews.author: James M

customer_reviews.title: Bad key layout if you touch type
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard layout is bad so it's frustrating. Putting the up arrow where the right shift key is supposed to be is a mistake, and the backspace key is difficult to hit without looking. It is not the same layout as desktop or regular laptop keyboards, and that's not great since I've been typing for 20 years. Edited: the manufacturer contacted me and took acceptable measures to make the situation right. I still don't like the layout of this keyboard, but I ended up buying another one they sell that's slightly bigger, in part because their service is good. I updated the star rating to reflect this.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Nilsen

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and cool folding Bluetooth Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a very useful product; it allows me to use my iPhone as a little monitor/computer when I use the easel case. It has great feel and action and lets me type longer texts and emails much faster and more accurately than using thumb typing. It's small, light and cool. It links to my iPhone faster than any other Bluetooth products I own (earpiece, speakers, etc.). I have only one issue, and that's when I'm texting and touch the return key, it sends out the text rather than start a new paragraph. I'm sure there's a workaround, but I haven't found it yet. Great product and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: PFJohns

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is small as noted in other reviews but that's part of this device's charm. I have no issues typing on it, there was a learning curve but it was short lived. My current use of this is being hooked up to my samsung note 8 on a dex station at work. I have my work computer and separate monitor and my phone connected to a second monitor. I can now multi task across devices.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Finally!!!
customer_reviews.text: At last, a foldable keyboard that does the job! I’ve tried several foldable keyboards - including some from iClever - but most left me disappointed one way or another. This is the first foldable keyboard I have had where I can type as I can on any other keyboard. It also feels as strong and durable as advertised. Time will tell how this works out down the road but so far I’m impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Scottso

customer_reviews.title: Design Flaw
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard works fine - but it has a major design flaw. If you are a decent typist (and presumably you are since you are looking to purchase a portable keyboard), you will quickly notice that the shift key on the right hand side is way too small. In fact, the "up" key is in the place where the right shift key should be, therefore, it takes a lot of getting used to and causes frequent annoying mistakes.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with my iPad Pro
customer_reviews.text: Love the keyboard. It seems well built and is solid. It did not, however, work with my iPad Pro. I tried for 30 minutes to get it to pair via bluetooth, but it simply would not. I thought it may be the iPad Pro, but found another bluetooth keyboard that immediately connected no problem. So unfortunately I had to give it 1-star. According to the literature in the package, it is compatible with the iPad Pro so should have worked.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.J

customer_reviews.title: Passable...
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent keyboard. I’m using it for school and I love the compact size of it. My only concerns are that the keys are getting stuck. It’s brand new and I am definitely not a heavy handed person, but it’s annoying to have to go back and erase things. Sometimes it’s the enter key, sometimes it is the comma, or the question mark. Whichever key it is, it’s really annoying having to go back and fix the errors. If it didn’t have this problem, I would have zero problems with giving 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Gongju00

customer_reviews.title: Best foldable keyboard I have found
customer_reviews.text: I used this keyboard to write my daily journals on my iPhone on a 3 month, 2,500 mile mountain bike (bicycle) ride from Montana to Mexico to Phoenix. I only had to charge it a half dozen times and it held up well the entire trip, even after forgetting it was in my otherwise empty daypack and sitting on it for an entire lunch break one day. The tri-fold design works better than the single fold designs when using the keyboard on ones lap. I would buy this again should this one ever need replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Mark U

customer_reviews.title: Key malfunction!!
customer_reviews.text: In the beginning it worked really well, but then the “?” Key started to get stuck. The “?” key is located where the keyboard folds. It often stays stuck and repeats, or it does not register when pressed. This basically makes the keyboard almost impossible to use. Too bad, because for the time it worked, I liked the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne D.

customer_reviews.title: Very portable, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something that I could use with my iPad pro when I travel. Needed something lightweight and small. this had great reviews so I thought I'd give it a try. It works beautifully. Connected with no problems and is so comfortable to use, that I even use it at home. Small backspace took a small bit to get used to, but I didn't find it to be a big deal. The bag it comes in is nice and will protect it from scratches when I toss it in my bag on the go.
customer_reviews.author: OneTreeStudio

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: Customer service was excellent and iClever replaced my keyboard even passed 30 day period and started using it again a few weeks ago and keyboard been solid. Will absolutely buy again from iClever. =============== Original review ================= "1st batch of order was DOA with hinge not opening all the way. Replaced with a 2nd iClever keyboard and this one lasted for 4 months and some of the keys stopped working."
customer_reviews.author: hilpcarz

customer_reviews.title: Not a full sized keyboard. The f keys are also not their own keys.
customer_reviews.text: It’s too small. When opened it’s not a full fixed keyboard so it’s not very ergonomic.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard except for up-key in the wrong place
customer_reviews.text: It is small and works well, for the most part. If you are used to small keyboards (I have a small Asus 10" laptop), there shouldn't be a problem with the size. The only problem is the right shift key. It is placed outside of the up-key. My pinkie keeps hitting the up-key instead of shift. It is a VERY annoying example of form over function. The up-key is directly above the down-key, but it would work just as well if it traded places with the shift key. Otherwise, the keys respond nicely to touch typing and I am looking forward to taking this on my travels. EXCEPT that stupid up-key!!!
customer_reviews.author: B. Clements

customer_reviews.title: Not good for fast, efficient typing needs.
customer_reviews.text: I type fairly fast - I noticed this keyboard does not recognize a few letters while I type so I always have to slow down to make sure I am not intentionally making any typos. I am not sure if this is because I received a faulty device, or if it is the device in general, but I will be returning my device.
customer_reviews.author: IggysaurusX

customer_reviews.title: Not for accurate typing
customer_reviews.text: It’s small and the ultimate in portability and is great for typing passwords and small bits. The only major flaw is a big one for me. The Shift key is tiny and the up arrow is right next to it so if you type fast, you’ll be constantly stopping to put the curser back in the right place every time you need to capitalize a word. If you won’t be typing much it’s good to take on the road, but you’ll want to throw it out the window if you’re writing more than a paragraph.
customer_reviews.author: CLin

customer_reviews.title: Not really a good substitue for a regular keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Not perfect: the placement of the keys on the right side of the keyboard are not quite correct if you're used to typing without looking where you place your fingers. Still, it's a convenient to make changes and corrections than just erasing an entire entry because the iPhone won't make access to that part of the screen convenient. Due to the bad placement of the right-side's keys, this isn't a good substitute for a regular keyboard for long term typing, so I'll probably bite the bullet and buy a full sized keyboard, which defeats the purpose of keeping everything in small units for backpack transport.
customer_reviews.author: D. Arnett

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well with my raspberry pi
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to use this keyboard with my raspberry pi single board computer. It runs linux and has bluetooth connectivity. Would like to have a keyboard that doesn't use one of the USB slots. The keyboard pairs and connects, then disconnects and then I can't get it to connect again. It might be a Linux or rPi issue because the keyboard works well with other bluetooth PCs I own. Was just hoping it would work for the rPi. My bluetooth mouse works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Wow, fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent folding keyboard. It is compact but still pretty easy on which to type. The base is made of metal, and so quite durable. It is still fairly light and folds up into a very small package. It works with Windows and Android tablets, and also my my smartphone. That makes replying to numerous emails on the go pretty painless.
customer_reviews.author: Argonaut

customer_reviews.title: Compact, good Bluetooth connection.
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. People need to get over the fact that some keys won’t be where they are on a full-sized keyboard. It’s smaller, so some keys will be out of place. I am writing this review on this keyboard right now. My advice would be to slow down your typing until you get use to the key placement. It does skip letters if you don’t hit them in the right spot, but so does my full-sized one. Overall, a good product, and I am glad that it tri folds and there is no crease in the middle. The Bluetooth connects right away and there is no lag.
customer_reviews.author: Skinnyminnie

customer_reviews.title: So close to good.
customer_reviews.text: Can not use this keyboard on your lap as it folds back up when typing on it. No easily apparent way to lock it open. Slippery. Comes with little rubber feet to stick on I'm guessing they will quickly be lost. Folds very small, fits into a pocket. Bluetooth was very easy to set up. This was expensive and will sit on a small stack of other keyboards that have failed. to be useful. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kirlin

customer_reviews.title: Want to Love It But...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second keyboard; the first iclever keyboard was returned for the same problem that is occurring with its replacement. The keys are scrambled and do not always reflect the key depressed. Three stars given for 3/4 of the keys correspond to its symbol. If anyone has had this problem and was able to resolve it, I would like to know how? I like the idea of the Bluetooth lightweight functionality of the keyboard, but don’t know why it is not performing as designed.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel companion Multiple devices as i have my iPad and iPhone setup on each channel.
customer_reviews.text: Typing on the new wireless keyboard. It will definitely take some getting used to but I must say this is something i will be using on a daily basis. I really like the function keys, being able to toggle and use shortcuts are a must and having that at my fingertips have been amazing. Response time typing are amazing and respond with an instant I have been using it for about an hour without charging and still running perfectly. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Feels like the Future!!
customer_reviews.text: Writing this on my keyboard right now and I am not having this "E" key issue that I was seeing in some reviews. The metal casing and the hinges seem very durable. I could easily see this thing lasting for ages. I have fairly large hands and I couldn't see myself typing on this for more than an hour, but that is not the purpose you would buy this keyboard for.
customer_reviews.author: Scotti

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up from China!
customer_reviews.text: I got this keyboard for my girlfriend during our trip to Hong Kong. She spends a lot more time on her phone than I do so I thought she'd find this useful. It has sturdy construction and it doesn't wobble at all. Just follow the instruction to connect it to your device and get typing - it works just like all keyboards. It's slightly heavier than anticipated; but that just translates to the keyboard having a good construction and being made sturdy. All in all, she loves this stylish little portable keyboard and uses it quite a bit during meetings to take notes. She highly recommends it.
customer_reviews.author: Rayn

customer_reviews.title: Very nifty little item!
customer_reviews.text: Got it. Charged it up. It paired right away to my phone. Started typing away! I originally got this to use as a census taker, but found out that since it is not an "approved" device, I can't use it with my census phone. However, I'm sure I'll find a bunch of uses for it with my phone and tablet. It folds up really nicely and the keyboard is good and solid. Glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: VinniesMom

customer_reviews.title: Well Engineered, Very Useful Device
customer_reviews.text: I have difficulty texting because I fat thumb so many key strokes. This key board solves my problem. It is easy to use and is a surprisingly good key board. It folds into a very small package. I keep it nearby and use it for longer texting. I liked it so much, I bought a second one for a friend who was having issues with her thumbs and she really liked it too.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile, but some flaws
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty good. I don't know why I thought the rugged hinges would help it stay open but that is not the case. Definitely need to have something solid under it. Do get a fair number of repetitive keys / typos and the keyboard takes some getting use to. But, it is better than trying to type on the phone and great for times when I can't open a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan S.

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is cool when you first open it but typing on it was not good at all. The keys you use a lot are tiny and I found myself making tons of mistakes on it. I typically type around 80-100wpm but on this thing I’d be doing good if I got 30 by the time I correct all my mistakes. Disappointing because mechanically it seemed like it could have been cool.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn H. Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Portable and handy
customer_reviews.text: Freaking love this thing! Using it to type this review! ;) Once linked to my phone it syncs quickly ever time you unfold it. The keys make a quiet but pleasing click as you type. My only complaint would be that I tend to hit the arrow up key when I'm trying to hit the shift key thinnking that the shift key is wider. The more I use the keyboard the more comfortable I've gotten. Looked into the standard tablet keyboard but most of those come with cases and since I wanted to use it with my phone that just wasn't practical. Once folded, and in its cute pouch, it fits easily in my purse.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bender

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Great for traveling & typing w/iPad.
customer_reviews.text: I saw this keyboard as a demo at the Romance Writers of America Conference this year and loved it. I purchased a different one to begin with and it just didn’t work as well as this one - the key spacing was weird & it was awkward. I love this one w/one small issue - the right shift key is too far to the right so I keep hitting the page up arrow instead. Since I use my right hand for most shifts, this will take some getting used to. Others may not have this problem.
customer_reviews.author: TJS

customer_reviews.title: Performs very well for a nice foldable alternative
customer_reviews.text: Reminiscent of the old foldable keyboard I had for my Palm Pilot decades back, this one nicely follows the tradition for today's devices. Nice and portable that promptly pairs and responds to bluetooth devices upon unfolding. The keyboard may not be a full-sized one, but still functions as a comfortable alternative to any onscreen keyboard for extended typing/encoding. Though it may not have removable batteries, I have neither had any interruptions in my use, nor found the need to recharge it very often between uses.
customer_reviews.author: M. E. G. M.

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleasantly surprised by just how nice this keyboard feels. The hinges are super satisfying to open, the metal casing feels very sturdy, and it overall just feels great. I'm holding back a star, however, because 1) the keyboard is a bit loud and 2) the sizing of some of the keys is questionable, especially the tiny backspace and tab key compared to the giant backslash. I would not recommend trying to write any essays on this thing, but it has suited my purposes--a functional travel keyboard-- very well. Also, the carrying case it came with was a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great potential, but frequent typing errors
customer_reviews.text: A fun device that changes the way you interact with your mobille devices. Soliidly built, great design, never has trouble connecting to the phone immediately. However, the kkeyboard has a tendency to douuble type letters. I wrote this review with the keyboard, and youu can see that double typing is happening in abbout 1 out of 10 words. Thhis makes the keyboard much less usable than I hoped it would be. EDIT: On the good side, after contacting the company about the issue the return process was easy.
customer_reviews.author: R Blaize B Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Piece of Hardware
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent addition to my tablet. Since I use my tablet for travel and email response (particularly for overseas work), this provides the ability to type out a comprehensive response while on the road. If you are a fast typist, and want the ability to respond with paragraphs of information, or even generate documents, this is a great product. It folds up very small, is sturdy and well engineered. With a slightly bigger tablet bag, you can slip this into it. I'm a complete convert on using this tablet/keyboard combo vs lugging a laptop around (or providing slight, and useless, responses). Highly recommended for the thorough communicator, a great piece to have in your toolkit!!
customer_reviews.author: MrTwistoff

customer_reviews.title: Well designed, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Charged keyboard launches when opened and remains paired with the previoiusly paired iPhone. No need to turn the iClever on/off after each use. Fullsize keys support fast typing. To convert the keyboard to typing in another language, set the keyboard in the phone’s Control app, The keyboard folds to a convenient size to carry in a large pocket/brief case or tote. It comes with a velvet drawstring pouch for storage.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lewin

customer_reviews.title: Key Layout very distracting/difficult to accomodate
customer_reviews.text: I liked this keyboard a lot from a design/size perspective. For a compact keyboard the size is good. However, the shift key on the right is placed "past" the up arrow key and so whenever I try to capitalize a letter I hit "up" and go to the beginning of my message/tweet/email etc. So frustrating because otherwise the keyboard is quite nice but I found that this was such a time-waster that I had to return the product.
customer_reviews.author: Adam L. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: I used to travel with a laptop, now I travel with a phone and an iPad. The iClever Bluetooth arrived today. It was super easy to connect to both the iPhone and iPad, the directions for installing the device on more than one unit were clear and easy to follow. The ergonomics are very different because of the size of the product but that was to be expected. I love how it folds without impacting the distance between the keys and I am donating my old Bluetooth keyboard immediately. The IClever is all that it was advertised to be and I am super happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara L Jones

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but quite good
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a keyboard for when I didn't have my laptop, so I could still type reasonably on my phone. this works for that. As a bonus, this works with my apple tv. No more using the remote for a keyboard! It's not a great keyboard compared to one that doesn't fold, but for what it is, transportable and small, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Voracious Reader

customer_reviews.title: only worked once
customer_reviews.text: Took it out of the box, paired it with my phone fairly easily, and it seemed to work well. Turn it off, try it again later, it doesn't even turn on when I open it. I think that maybe the battery wasn't fully charged when I got it. I plugged it in, the red light goes on, and NEVER turns off like it's supposed to, which means it's not charging. AT ALL. So basically I have a bricked device after a single use. Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: David Ward

customer_reviews.title: Connects easily and makes texting a breeze
customer_reviews.text: As opposed to the first keyboard I ordered, this one offered no problem in connecting to my Android phone. Initially, I had a bit of trouble with one touch of a key resulting in many printings of that key, but that resolved after just a couple more sends. About the only problem this has caused is that my texts, instead of being 1 or 2 sentences often result in multiple paragraphs ... but I guess that says something bad about me rather than about the product. I'm very happy with this and have already advised some friends to order one for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Lester Kallus

customer_reviews.title: If you're on the fence about this - jump over to the "BUY IT" side, already
customer_reviews.text: When folded it's slightly larger than a midrange cell phone, although a bit heavier. When open, the keyboard is about the size one would've found on a netbook of about eight years ago; so, while it's small, it's not cramped. I'm pleased with how sturdily constructed it is, and the hinges don't really bend up unless you're trying to type on a very soft surface indeed. This was my only Prime Day buy... and as of now, September 25th, I haven't needed to charge the battery yet. I absolutely love it - I can now officially do everything except gaming that I'd use a desktop computer for on my phone!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Must have for traveling or work
customer_reviews.text: Just received it today and I’m loving the simplicity of it. I just need a Portable keypad and this does the trick. It’s small enough where I can pull it out of my purse, type what I need to get done and fold it back up away. Once folded up, it’s about the size of a Nintendo DS. It also comes with a pouch to store the keypad inside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is amazing. I've paired it once to my iPad and every time I've used it, I just open it up and start typing. No re-pairing, which I find to be a pain. Just unfold it and start typing. It folds up very small and is easy to travel with. The case it comes with makes traveling with it that mush easier. Every time I have used it I am impressed with it. It's held a charge for a month and I've used it quite a bit. It seems to be very well made and is comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Queen Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great portable keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard to use with my work ipad for traveling. It works great! The battery life is long, the product seems to be well made and the bluetooth connection works great! For being such a small keyboard, the typing is easier than I imagined, although it does take some getting used to. Overall I would definitely recommend this product to a friend!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard works, it connected to both my phone and PC without an issue I love how small it is, it frees up a lot of space on a small desk. The keys are positioned pretty nicely, It isn't too different than typing on a laptop, so I can still type with decent speed. The only thing to kind of adjust to from a full size is if you use a lot of keyboard shortcuts, since the keys are a little closer you will kind of need to adjust how you reach for multiple keys at a time. So far I love it though.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C Duttweiler

customer_reviews.title: not as spected
customer_reviews.text: What I had in mind when I saw the pictures was 'sturdy'; this is not how I feel it, or at least compared to other keyboards. Also, the description points aluminum as a selling point; I am not sure but it looks as if the reinforcements on the folds may not be aluminum but plastic painted to look as metal; can not tell for sure though
customer_reviews.author: Jairo Supelano

customer_reviews.title: Like In the movie Road House, I thought it would be bigger
customer_reviews.text: I works well and it hold a charge for a long time. Easy to connect to my Surface Pro. I was hoping that the keyboard would be larger than the Surface Pros, but smaller than a full keyboard. I think it is as large as the Surface keyboard. I still like the flexibility to not being tied to the Surface.
customer_reviews.author: Cromarty Ladd

customer_reviews.title: Nifty idea, terrible keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It’s an excellent idea, but a terrible keyboard. It’s not very sturdy, or duarable, and had trouble keeping a connection to the iPad. Update: I’m adding a star for excellent customer service. As soon as they saw that I had problems with my keyboard, they issued me a refund. I’m now thinking of checking out the updated version of the keyboard...
customer_reviews.author: HannahofIN

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, but started dying after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Excellent keyboard! Does exactly what it said it would do. I love how compact it is. Keys take a bit to get used to, but I did get used to them. The only issue happened 3 years and 3 months after use, where the keys started dying for some reason. I've used the keyboard moderately, maybe a couple times a week on average (not for intense typing or anything). Right now the "plus" and "minus" button stopped working, and the paralyzation is sort of making its way down the rows. The E key is also inconsistent now. So I can confirm that this is an excellent keyboard... up until around the 3 year mark.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin G. Lam

customer_reviews.title: Sync is easy and fast
customer_reviews.text: Nice, well made keyboard. I've had a number of mini boards dating back to the Palm Pilot days. They all work, but most feel flimsy and after awhile some keys just stop responding. This board has a great feel from the overall construction of the two hinges to the feel of the individual keys. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Blaize

customer_reviews.title: Rugged. Reliable. Travels well. Long battery life.
customer_reviews.text: It fits in my bag or my pocket. It is very rugged, suffering a variety of impacts and squashes and other abuse in my travels and continues to work. Battery life is much much better than expected. It is not a full size keyboard and does take some getting used to typing on such a compact keyboard. My only complaint is the positioning of the right shift key. I frequently miss it and hit the up-arrow instead.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love
customer_reviews.text: This may sound silly, but this keyboard makes me smile every time I use it. It is solidly constructed and the keys are responsive, it is a good size, and light. Battery life is insanely long. (I charge it occasionally even though it has never died on me). Set up all your devices to pair with it (maybe takes 5 minutes to read the instructions and another 5 to add all). Take a photo of the instructions before you lose them, as set up is not intuitive. I carry this in my backpack around the world to generate website content on my iPad, and it is GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: Hamilton Davis

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to make edits
customer_reviews.text: This keybboard is geat for portability, however it often will double a letter with a single keystroke oor leave it out entirely. It can be quite frustrating while writing due to havingg to constantly go back and erase the extra key or add the absent letter of the word you are typing. II am using the keyboard to type now and you can see ow it rights unedited. I would definitely look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok for passwords, not for emails
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's compact and easy to store. However, the keys are set up in a clumsy way. I'm always hitting the arrow keys instead of the shift key and need the light on if I'm typing anything longer than a sentence. It's good for logging into games or sites, but not for use with writing emails....or reviews. (I'm using a full keyboard for this review.)
customer_reviews.author: D Rayburn

customer_reviews.title: this easily fits in a small backpack or tote bag/purse
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this portable keyboard about a month go and wanted to get proper use before reviewing. This little keyboard rocks! I use it in conjunction with my iPad, instead of lugging my laptop everywhere, and since it tri-folds, this easily fits in a small backpack or tote bag/purse, or if your a minimalist, in a cargo pocket. This is very easy to link, via Bluetooth, with my iPad and my iPhone (took about 3 secs). I can get about 2 weeks of medium use from one charge. Comes with a suede-like protection bag, micro usb charging cable, manual, and product guarantee. Completely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney L.

customer_reviews.title: Dandy
customer_reviews.text: The storage bag is an excellent idea when it’s being toted around in a backpack Full of lint and unmentionables. The trifold makes it very compact. Trade-offs between size and portability are quite acceptable. Mine is not used frequently but when it is it is most welcome. Like now.
customer_reviews.author: FolkKey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and no gaps between the keys where it folds
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little keyboard! I bought this for my wife who is a travel nurse and uses it with the tablet that her company requires her to use. Paired easily and she really likes that all you have to do is open it and it works. She is very pleased with it. She also likes the fact that there are no gaps between the keys where it folds.
customer_reviews.author: Gil Cowden

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my brother. It seemed to work well for him for a month or two, but eventually gave out. He wasn't being rough with it to my knowledge, so the folding design may have caused some instability. Needed to update this from three stars for customer service. Shortly after posting this, I received an email from the seller offering to send me a prepaid postage stamp to return the potentially defective item to get a new one. My brother did not keep the keyboard so this isn't an option, but I think that the point stands that the seller is willing to make sure their product is good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great. Just not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard looks awesome. The issue is all of the quirks when typing. Total issues with quirks. Hard to type when it’s adding characters or jumping back to the front of the sentence.
customer_reviews.author: W Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Find one with a key layout you're used to and with something to prop the device you use up.
customer_reviews.text: Functional, no obvious issues, but the exterior scuffs incredibly easily, looks bad. It is not as sturdy as the metallic appearance in pictures suggests. The shift and backspace are inconveniently small and awkwardly placed, e.g. shift is smaller than the adjacent, less-used keys! These two are frequently used enough that if you're used to a normal keyboard, they throw off the flow enough to negate the benefit of having the keyboard. Find one with a key layout you're used to and with something to prop the device up if it's your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Lawanda Washington

customer_reviews.title: Returned.
customer_reviews.text: Did not work out of the box. Turned on but wouldn't pair with any of my devices. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: B. Richards

customer_reviews.title: So far, I really like this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this keyboard for about a week, and have used it a few times. I really like it. There is a bit of an adjustment with typing due to the size of the keyboard and the feel of the keys, but all in all I'm super happy with it. I wish I bought this sooner - could have saved a lot of pain when working on longer emails on my phone!
customer_reviews.author: Fala

customer_reviews.title: Novel idea
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard to be able to write on my phone when I am waiting at the mechanic shop, or other places where taking my laptop would be inconvenient or bulky. My son thinks it's so cool, he wanted one too. The first one I revived did not hold a charge, but they were great to quickly exchange it with very little hassle and the replacement works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Ann Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Good quality keyboard with some key placement issues
customer_reviews.text: Love the quality of this keyboard. Quick and connects to my iPad. Only complaint is the right finger shift button. I constantly hit the arrow key where my finger says the shift button should be. If I used this keyboard daily it would work itself out. As it is, I tend not to use it as much as I thought. It could also benefit from rubber feet that keeps it from sliding around
customer_reviews.author: Neil B

customer_reviews.title: Good piece of keyboard input for big screen smartphones
customer_reviews.text: Good piece for workaholics using their big screen Smartphones to make crazy the whatsapp individuals or groups ! (not my case), a big Samsung A9 detected easily and made as a predetermined writing input. Key sensitive and is really good for such a small size. Just one flaw for the designers but could be resolved by people: it might come with a fixed inclined base heavy and rubberized, it is quite flat so it is not ergonomic to spend time writing there over the table. The general small design and flexibility is good, have to give 5 stars so far.
customer_reviews.author: EMONT

customer_reviews.title: Great compact keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I got this keyboard to use with my Note 8 and it works great. It's slightly wider and shorter than my phone and fits easily into my purse, which is on the small side. I do wish that the function keys had their own row because I tend to use the buttons that control my music all the time and it's going to take some training to remember I need to hold down the "Fn" key at the same time to use them. Otherwise, I have no complaints. I wanted something portable and that's exactly what this keyboard delivers for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Wren

customer_reviews.title: Grear size, well made
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for use with my iPad and it is perfect. Love the portability. Takes a bit of adjustment getting used to a smaller keyboard—some of the keys aren’t in the same place as a standar keyboard—but nothing difficult. The quality seems really nice so far, the connection was extremely simple, and I have no hesitation recommending this keyboard to others.
customer_reviews.author: S. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great overall, but finicky space bar
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a LOT of bluetooth keyboards before buying this and I'm glad I waited. This keyboard folds so small I can fit it in my back pocket, and works great with one exception listed at the end. The charge lasts for a long time and recharges pretty quickly. The only negative is that about 1/4 of the time I hit the space bar it doesn't register it, which can be frustrating when touch typing a long email.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Keys are badly located
customer_reviews.text: Design is clever but, in addition to the fact that it's too small for large hands, the keys on the right side are oddly located, especially delete and the shift, so I'm constantly making mistakes. Also, for some reasons many of the letters I type repeat, though I can't tell if it's because it's so hard to strike them in the center.
customer_reviews.author: David Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Touch Typers Beware!
customer_reviews.text: This little keyboard is a clever design, EXCEPT some OCD engineer decided the up arrow HAS TO BE immediately over the down arrow. This moves the right shift one key further to the right than it should be. If you are a touch typer, this will drive you crazy and severely limit the functionality of this keyboard (I keep inadvertently moving the cursor up one line every time I try to capitalize a letter). Swap those two keys (up arrow and right shift), and this keyboard would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: I've had this keyboard for a while now and love it! It is very well made and feels ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this keyboard for a while now and love it! It is very well made and feels like it's going to last for a long time. The battery lasts a good long time. As others have noted the right "shift" key is awkwardly placed and has caused a few problems. My biggest complaint is that the number keys are shifted from a standard keyboard layout. I'm a touch typist so I'm constantly hitting the wrong numbers if I don't remember. I understand that some compromises had to be made to make a compact folding keyboard and It's not a deal breaker for me, just something I have to keep in mind while typing.
customer_reviews.author: Roka

product_meta.title: iClever BK03 Bluetooth Keyboard, Bluetooth 5.1 Foldable Wireless Keyboard with Portable Pocket Size, Aluminum Alloy Housing, Carrying Pouch, for iOS Windows Android Tablets, Laptops and Smartphones
product_meta.description:
Color:SilveriClever - Ever Clever

This ultra slim tri-folding Bluetooth keyboard lets you enjoy creating and communicating across multiple platforms on Bluetooth enabled devices wirelessly. 
With a compact and portable design, this wireless Bluetooth keyboard is the perfect keyboard for travel. 

Broad Compatibility 
The muti-device portable keyboard works well with all Bluetooth enabled devices with IOS, Android or Windows system. 

Operating Range
The newest Bluetooth 5.1 chip provides up to 33 feet without any issues in connection for great typing. 

Compact and Lightweight 
The tri-folding Bluetooth keyboard is compact and lightweight (pocket sized), perfect for travel. When folded, the keyboard is smaller than an iPhone 6 Plus. 

Comfortable and Quiet Typing The whisper quiet keys allow you to work anywhere.

Aircraft-grade Aluminum 
Made of aircraft-grade aluminum for superior durability.

Anodized Matte Process
Creates excellent sense of touch. 

Note:
1.It is not compatible with Nokia phones,Mac mini and Windows 8 operating systems. 
2.After connecting with the device, you must press Fn and A/S/D key (A for Android, S for iOS, D for Windows) to select operating system. 
3.To activate the function of icon marked in blue color, please press Fn and blue color keys simultaneously
4.Fold it to power off the keyboard to conserve energy if it is not in use. Do not use out of the Bluetooth coverage.

Package Content: 
Bluetooth Keyboard 
1 x USB Charging Cable
1 x Carrying Pouch
1 x User Manual
feature_bullets: RECOMMENDED FOR EDITORS: Write down your stories or ideas any time any where you want as long as you own one iClever BK03, the slim and reliable typing partner

PORTABLE & LIGHTWEIGHT: Convenient and lightweight (6.3OZ) pocket sized, tri-folding bluetooth keyboard, perfect for travel. And 4 silicone pads were attached to keep this folding keyboard stable. even though it's slim and lightweigh, you don't need to worry it will move when you typing.

iOS, WINDOWS & ANDROID COMPATIBILITY: Built-in Broadcom Bluetooth 5.1 module with an operating range of 33 feet. Three-channel Buetooth make it easy to set up three devices at once with this multi-device Bluetooth keyboard

ERGONOMIC & DURABLE DESIGN: Premium aluminum alloy texture (aircraft-grade) for superior durability. Auto power off and sleep mode function helps to conserve battery. Built-in rechargeable lithium battery
RELIABLE AND FRIENDLY CUSTOMER SERVICE： ready to respond within a 24 hour time frame.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,475 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
